sn10.8:2.1: BB follows comm in expanding this to 100,000, but the Chinese parallels at SA 592 and SA2 186 prefer the more modest and literal figure of 100.
sn10.8:2.4: āmukka is a variant of āmutta.
sn10.8:2.5: BB’s “step” for padavitihara is incorrect, it is a special term denoting a “great stride forward” for which “stride” alone is barely adequate. He has adopted “stride” in AN.
